creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: loose geometric drawing of a woman's head and shoulders, facing to the right of the picture plane
inscription:
Signature, Inscription

-- in graphite: #46465
-- in graphite on verso: 65- (possibly the price) | 0224 | (other marks cannot be seen until drawing is unglued from backing sheet)
-- framer label on cardboard on back of frame: A Heydenryk Frame, The House of Heydenryk, 141 West 54th Street, New York 19, N.Y.
-- taped to back of frame: Clipping entitled \"Catching the Jagged Moment\"
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed in graphite, lower right: [EL Kirchner]
title: Head Study, Facing Right
